name: Bankless
title: Why crypto 4-year cycles keep happening #btc #eth #crypto #investing #podcast
text:
Synopsis
Bitcoin's four-year market cycles are driven by the halving event, which systematically reduces mining output and creates upward price pressure through constrained supply.

Key Insights
- Bitcoin experiences predictable four-year market cycles tied to the halving event
- Miners consistently sell newly mined Bitcoin to fund operational expenses (hardware, electricity)
- Each halving cuts Bitcoin production by approximately 50%
- Reduced supply combined with constant demand creates upward price momentum
- The amplitude of these market cycles is moderating with each successive cycle
- The current market cycle suggests potential for Bitcoin to reach all-time high prices around $100,000
